contents: The effects of eruptions can be widespread. Volcanic ash can cause health problems and poor visibility. It can even affect the ozone layer. Rain and melting snow mixed with ash can cause dangerous mudflows. Large eruptions can (12) <u>change the weather and interfered</u> with agriculture. While humanity’s ability to predict and mitigate damage from volcanic eruptions has grown, volcanoes are a natural phenomena that will continue to affect our planet.
